document_data.mainbody:
Dwarven bloodstone blades were enchanted dwarven waraxes decorated with bloodstones mined in the Galena Mountains of Damara.
Dwarven bloodstone blades possessed a +2 enchantment and a magically keen edge. Additionally, these waraxes dealt additional damage when wielded against giants.
These weapons were crafted by the dwarves of Clan Hillsafar in the depths of the Galena Mountains. They were crafted in a variety of designs and possessed different magical powers. The first dwarven bloodstone blades were forged as gifts to a band of dwarven adventurers who helmed a campaign against the "Thunkers," a band of giant bandits. These eccentric adventurers named themselves "Anti-Thunkers" after securing Clan Hillsafars mining business from the giant menace. In the 1370s DR, the Anti-Thunkers moved on from the land of Damara, and copies of their bloodstone blades began appearing in other regions of the Realms. In the , dwarven bloodstone blades were sold in Westgate, among countless unique and rare weapons and armor on the citys Market Triangle.
